appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that global lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT+) issues are permanently part of the government’s agenda and the wider national conversation about human rights and equality, raised by well-briefed and motivated parliamentarians both nationally and internationally.

appg_groups.name: Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.purpose: To accelerate the progress towards ending the TB epidemic.

appg_groups.name: Governance and Inclusive Leadership
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Governance and Inclusive Leadership
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the issue of inclusive leadership and governance in all areas of society with the aim of tackling the barriers prohibiting people from visible minorities from achieving positions of power and influence throughout the UK.

appg_groups.name: Grid Networks
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Grid Networks
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG provides the opportunity for stakeholders from across the private, public and third sectors to engage with policy makers on the issues, challenges and opportunities in the energy sector relating to grid connectivity and investment.

appg_groups.name: Gypsies Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing

appg_groups.name: Hadrians Wall
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hadrian's Wall
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the 150 mile long UNESCO world heritage site and associated tourism outside of the north-east region; and to explore ways of increasing the importance of Hadrian's wall as an economic and cultural asset for every part of its route across the north-east and Cumbria.

appg_groups.name: Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with blood-borne viruses due to contaminated blood and blood products used in their healthcare treatment.

appg_groups.name: Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.purpose: To establish facts about the UK Hajj and Umrah sectors, promote and enable an industry led partnership with government to set minimum standards and good practice for Hajj and Umrah services sold in the UK, promote active and precautionary health and wellbeing, and have appropriate consular and other support services.

appg_groups.name: Hazaras
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hazaras
appg_groups.purpose: In recognising the persecution and other atrocities committed against Hazaras, the group will work towards protecting and enhancing the human rights and status of Hazaras around the world.

appg_groups.name: Heritage and Regeneration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage and Regeneration
appg_groups.purpose: To support built and historic environment conservation as the means to deliver successful places, which are economically, environmentally and socially sustainable. This includes using heritage to help places adapt to the diverse needs of current and future communities, whilst supporting enterprise, transport connectivity, health, climate change efforts and quality of life.

appg_groups.name: Heritage Rail
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage Rail
appg_groups.purpose: To brief parliamentarians about heritage railways, the contribution they make to their local and regional economies and the skills training opportunities involved.

appg_groups.name: HIV AIDS and Sexual Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV, AIDS and Sexual Health
appg_groups.purpose: To fight for the rights of people living with HIV and work to ensure all people living with HIV are able to access affordable medicines and a decent quality of life, free from stigma, discrimination and fear.

appg_groups.name: Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.purpose: To promote holocaust memorial and education in parliament; and to support the establishment of a holocaust memorial and learning centre.

appg_groups.name: the Holy See
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
appg_groups.purpose: To foster friendly relations between the UK and the Holy See.

appg_groups.name: Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians of all parties with an interest in and commitment to ending homelessness; focus on all types of homelessness and differing solutions needed; make recommendations for the work of a wide range of departments who are key to ending homelessness.

appg_groups.name: Hormone Pregnancy Tests
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hormone Pregnancy Tests
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of families affected by the use of the drug ‘Primodos’ and call for the implementation of recommendations in the Independent Medicines and Medical Devices Safety Review

appg_groups.name: Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of adults and children living with terminal or life-limiting conditions, and their families and carers, in parliament; and to promote person-centred, evidence-based policies to improve end of life care in all settings, including hospices, hospitals, care homes, and in people's own homes.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.purpose: To examine key issues, opportunities and challenges facing the hospitality sector across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality Events and Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality, Events and Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To inform members of the innovations, markets, trading and other economic activity of the sectors involved; to help raise awareness of the economic value of the sectors to Wales and to offer support, where possible, to the businesses and their employees to help the promotion of job retention, future growth and sustainability.

appg_groups.name: Households in Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Households in Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.purpose: The group will meet to discuss and campaign on issues related to households living in temporary accommodation.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

appg_groups.name: Housing Market and Housing Delivery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing Market and Housing Delivery
appg_groups.purpose: To inform and stimulate debate on relevant areas of policy affecting the UK housing market; to promote the importance of the delivery of new homes across all tenures; and to introduce parliamentarians to those involved in delivering housing and other experts and practitioners in the field.

appg_groups.name: Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

appg_groups.name: Human-Relevant Science
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human-Relevant Science
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers of all parties to accelerate the development and uptake of human relevant science in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hydrogen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hydrogen
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to engage with leading businesses and organisations that are working to enable the UK to meet its net-zero targets through implementation of hydrogen projects, and discuss policy options to support these.

appg_groups.name: Immigration Detention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Immigration Detention
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness in parliament about immigration detention in the UK and its impacts; to connect parliamentarians with relevant research, organisations and experts, including people with lived experience of detention; and to advocate for evidence-based policy reforms and the welfare of detainees.

appg_groups.name: Independent Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Independent Education
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss developments in the independent education sector, discuss issues facing the sector, highlight best practice, explore the wider contribution of the sector, share knowledge, and raise matters affecting the sector with government and sector leaders.

appg_groups.name: India Trade and Investment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for India (Trade and Investment)
appg_groups.purpose: To promote trade and investment between India and the UK for the mutual betterment of their citizens, whilst building an inclusive living bridge between the two countries.

appg_groups.name: Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate informed discussions on issues concerning all Indian Traditional Sciences practised in the UK and abroad (Ayurveda, Yoga, Jyotish, Vastu, Unani and Sangeet) for inclusion into the NHS by providing a forum for cross-party parliamentarians, senior policy makers, academics, practitioners, leading community figures and stakeholders.

appg_groups.name: Industrial Hemp and CBD Cannabidiol Products
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Hemp and CBD (Cannabidiol) Products
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage the development of UK regulation on Industrial Hemp and CBD products that reflects evidence-based policy, clear regulation and the most certain basis for investors and entrepreneurs to enable these sectors to safely serve the public and the wider national interests engaged in public wellness, climate change, and the economy.

appg_groups.name: Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

appg_groups.name: Infrastructure
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the importance of economic infrastructure in the UK amongst parliamentarians, decision makers and industry and to discuss how to ensure society gets the infrastructure it needs.

appg_groups.name: Intellectual Property
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intellectual Property
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property and the importance of its promotion and protection. The Group meets several times a year on topical issues relating to intellectual property.

appg_groups.name: Intensive Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Intensive Care
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the role and work of intensive care and critical care within the health system and strengthen the understanding of Members about the impact of intensive care on the treatment and recovery of patients.

appg_groups.name: International Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to address wildlife conservation and biodiversity issues affecting our planet including but not limited to ecosystem collapse, species extinctions, land degradation, invasive species, illegal fishing and other threats to the natural world.

appg_groups.name: International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and profile of international Freedom of Religion or Belief (Article 18, UDHR) as a human right among UK parliamentarians, the media, government and the general public. The group also seeks to increase the effectiveness of the UK's contribution to international institutions charged with enforcing this human right.

appg_groups.name: International Mediation and Conflict Resolution
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Mediation and Conflict Resolution
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate UK Parliamentarians in gaining a balanced insight into the causes of particular conflicts, to assist them in better understanding the role of international mediation in conflict resolution, and to consider how this approach might benefit the resolution and prevention of conflict, including seemingly intractable conflicts, across the globe.

appg_groups.name: International Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Students
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and 'soft power'; raise awareness of issues which affect international students and UK education; and provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, international education institutions and professionals and business leaders.

appg_groups.name: Investment Fraud and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Investment Fraud and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.purpose: To advocate for the victims of financial misconduct, crimes, scandals, frauds and regulatory failures, by driving positive, progressive, and purposeful reforms that achieve a fair, trusted and just system, where the service providers, regulators and government agencies provide appropriate protection and deliver good outcomes, including redress for historical wrongs.

appg_groups.name: Islamic and Ethical Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamic and Ethical Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight and improve areas of Islamic and ethical finance.

appg_groups.name: Issues Affecting Men and Boys
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Issues Affecting Men and Boys
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of disadvantages and poor outcomes faced by men and boys in education, mental/physical health and law; to influence attitudes, role models, policy and legislation that will lead to positive differences to their well-being and lives.

appg_groups.name: Jainism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Jainism
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of Jainism in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Key Cities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Key Cities
appg_groups.purpose: To offer a forum for parliamentarians to discuss matters of mutual interest across the UK's key cities. The Key Cities organisation is a cross-party initiative whose members are committed to ensuring that all UK cities are placed on a sustainable footing to deliver continued, inclusive economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Kinship Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Kinship Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of, and support for, kinship care and kinship carers by amplifying the voices and experiences of children in kinship care and their families. To inform parliamentarians and to promote policy and practice which supports more children to live safely within their family and friends network, when they cannot live with their parents.

appg_groups.name: Land Value Capture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Land Value Capture
appg_groups.purpose: To work in partnership with national and local government departments, land developers and others to create a forum for parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to discuss and develop innovative proposals to capture increases in land value, for the public benefit.

appg_groups.name: Lead Ammunition
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Lead Ammunition
appg_groups.purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of the negative impacts of lead ammunition use on human and animal health, wildlife conservation and the wider environment and to press for solutions.

appg_groups.name: Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to leasehold and commonhold legislation and regulation. Reduce opportunities for exploitation and improve cladding. Review the leasehold property Tribunal as a low-cost forum for disputes and redress including leasehold insurance and service charges which fall outside FCA regulation. Meet with and monitor government departments and publicly funded bodies working on leasehold.

appg_groups.name: Life Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation.

appg_groups.name: Limits to Growth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Limits to Growth
appg_groups.purpose: To create the space for cross-party dialogue on environmental and social limits to growth; to assess the evidence for such limits, identify the risks and build support for appropriate responses; and to contribute to the international debate on redefining prosperity.

appg_groups.name: Listed Properties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
appg_groups.purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties, including tax and planning reform.

appg_groups.name: Local Government
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

appg_groups.name: London
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
appg_groups.purpose: To promote London in the interests of all its people, places and businesses as a global city and powerhouse of the national economy.

appg_groups.name: Lower Carbon Construction Vehicles
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Lower Carbon Construction Vehicles
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign for local construction firms to continue to use volumetric concrete mobile plants (VCMs) at 38.4 tonnes on 4 axles and 44 tonnes on 5 axles to provide concrete services in every community with zero waste, fewer journeys and a lower carbon footprint.

appg_groups.name: Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians of the devastation that malaria and the neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) cause. Malaria and many of the NTDs are tractable disease. Suffering from malaria is avoidable. Malaria and many of the NTDs are treatable.

appg_groups.name: Marine Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Marine Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, supply chain and energy security benefits from the development of marine energy resources in and around the UK.

appg_groups.name: Maternity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maternity
appg_groups.purpose: To improve the quality of maternity services, raise awareness of the contribution maternity care can make to public health, and improve support during the first 1000 days of parenthood.

appg_groups.name: Media Freedom
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Media Freedom
appg_groups.purpose: To promote media freedom in countries around the world and to strengthen the protection of journalists.

appg_groups.name: Access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.purpose: To help secure appropriate access to medical cannabis on the NHS in its various forms including full plant extract containing both CBD and THC in formulations produced to a consistent high quality pharmaceutical grade and manufactured to GMP standard.

appg_groups.name: Mental Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mental Health
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about all aspects of mental health.

benefits_details.source: The Royal College of Joint Secretariat 6,001-7,500 05/02/2024 26/04/2024

appg_groups.name: Metal Stone and Heritage Crime
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Metal, Stone and Heritage Crime
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the social and economic impact of metal, stone and heritage crime.

appg_groups.name: Microplastics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Microplastics
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the effect microplastics have on the environment. The group will also work cross-party with stakeholders to discuss potential policy solutions.

appg_groups.name: Migration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Migration
appg_groups.purpose: To support the emergence of mainstream, progressive policy debate on migration in the UK parliament.

appg_groups.name: Mindfulness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mindfulness
appg_groups.purpose: To review research evidence, current best practice, extent and success of implementation, and potential developments in the application of mindfulness within a range of policy areas, and to develop policy recommendations for government based on these findings.

appg_groups.name: Minimally Invasive Cancer Therapies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Minimally Invasive Cancer Therapies
appg_groups.purpose: To drive awareness of minimally invasive cancer therapies and to ensure that eligible patients across the UK can have timely access.

appg_groups.name: Modern Conflict
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Conflict
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the capabilities and commitments driving contemporary warfare (including working by, with and through partners, use of drones and technological capabilities, and increase in covert operations) which are outpacing conventional oversight mechanisms and safeguarding regimes, and resulting in rising civilian casualties worldwide.

appg_groups.name: Modern Languages
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Languages
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the educational, skills-related, employment, competitive and cultural benefits of learning and using languages throughout the UK; to provide a parliamentary forum for information exchange and consultation on languages and linguists; to encourage and support policies and action improving the take-up of languages in schools, further and higher education, in the workplace and in the community.

appg_groups.name: Modernising Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modernising Employment
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is a cross-party group of Members of both Houses who share an interest in understanding how the UK labour market can lead the world in driving growth and providing a level playing field for everyone.

appg_groups.name: Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Motor Neurone Disease (MND) and to provide a forum for discussion of the issues facing people with MND and their families.

appg_groups.name: Motorsport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Motorsport
appg_groups.purpose: To support motorsport.

appg_groups.name: Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests of people affected by MS (Multiple Sclerosis).

appg_groups.name: Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.purpose: Raises awareness of all types of muscular dystrophy and neuromuscular conditions and promotes links between parliament, individuals and families affected by these muscle-wasting conditions, charities, scientists, health professionals and decision-makers.

appg_groups.name: Music
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a discussion forum between the music industry and parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Music Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Music Education
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians engaging in discussions relating to music education through early years, primary, secondary, SEND, further and higher education, and lifelong learning. The Group has a particular focus on Curriculum, the National Plan for Music Education, challenges facing higher education,and progression into the creative and cultural sector.

appg_groups.name: Muslim Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Muslim Women
appg_groups.purpose: To support social justice and equality for Muslim women and transform their lives by debating, scrutinising, investigating and raising awareness of issues affecting them to influence practice, policy, legislation and attitudes.

appg_groups.name: Mutuals
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mutuals
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and support mutuals.

appg_groups.name: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis ME
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME)
appg_groups.purpose: To seek to improve health, social care, education and employment opportunities for people with ME and encourage biomedical research into the cause and treatment of ME.

appg_groups.name: the National Trust
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the National Trust
appg_groups.purpose: To apply parliamentary scrutiny to the operational and strategic direction of the National Trust.

appg_groups.name: Neurodiversity in Defence and National Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Neurodiversity in Defence and National Security
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and raise awareness of issues related to neurodivergence in the context of UK defence and national security. The APPG seeks to provide a platform for discussions, advocacy and initiatives aimed at improving the inclusion and support of individuals with neurodivergent conditions in these sectors.

appg_groups.name: the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the cultural and economic importance of nightlife to the UK. To provide a cross-party voice for nightlife businesses, supply chains and patrons. To support parliamentarians’ understanding of how the sector operates. To identify solutions to challenges facing the sector and how nightlife can support the UK’s economic recovery from Covid-19.

appg_groups.name: Northern Ireland
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Northern Ireland
appg_groups.purpose: Promoting Northern Ireland in Westminster and fostering closer relationships between politicians of all the nations of the UK by creating greater understanding of the opportunities and issues of Northern Ireland.

appg_groups.name: Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.purpose: A forum for parliamentarians to discuss civil nuclear energy on a cross-party basis.

appg_groups.name: Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.purpose: To support and challenge the UK government to maintain their leadership on global nutrition and to make a significant pledge at the Nutrition for Growth summit in Tokyo 2020.

appg_groups.name: Nutrition Science and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nutrition: Science and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness and stimulate informed debate around regional, national and global nutrition issues; and to champion nutrition science to support evidence-based policy making in areas surrounding nutrition and health challenges.

appg_groups.name: Obesity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Obesity
appg_groups.purpose: To call on the government to prioritise and drive increased investment and resource into both the prevention and treatment of obesity.

appg_groups.name: Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and promotion of issues relating to occupational safety and health; to provide information to members of both Houses of Parliament on topical issues; and to publish reports as and when necessary.

appg_groups.name: the Ocean
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Ocean
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a collective space where all parliamentarians can support and promote ocean research and awareness, to develop greater understanding of the ocean and its role in tackling challenges such as climate change, and to debate wider issues.

appg_groups.name: Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to electrical safety online and in domestic dwellings and to promote the prevention of accidents with electricity; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to their constituents on electrical safety; and to hold inquiries into policy issues and provide reports.

appg_groups.name: Online Safety on Social Media
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Online Safety on Social Media
appg_groups.purpose: To drive policy change that mitigates the negatives and maximises the positives of social media for young people.

appg_groups.name: Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that Open Banking delivers maximum benefit and value to consumers, businesses and government; promotes effective competition and choice; reduces the cost of payments; supports innovation; and ensures that customers benefit from technological advances, and that new entrants and smaller providers can compete more fairly.

appg_groups.name: Opera
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Opera
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in opera; to further the appreciation of opera; and to provide a link between this art form and Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of osteoporosis amongst parliamentarians and to influence legislation and policy makers to improve the lives of people living with the condition. The APPG will consider how to promote behavioural change and systems changes so people of all ages can strengthen their bones and prevent osteoporosis.

appg_groups.name: the Packaging Manufacturing Industry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Packaging Manufacturing Industry.
appg_groups.purpose: To create a better understanding of the UK packaging manufacturing

appg_groups.name: the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of and help eliminate discrimination and persecution by the state and others; and to help develop an inclusive and tolerant Pakistan.

appg_groups.name: Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for politicians, scientists, health professionals, economists, business leaders and other experts; to facilitate broad, balanced and open discussion; to inform a more focussed and flexible approach to government policy; to reach for new solutions in pandemic management which prevent avoidable suffering and loss in the future.

appg_groups.name: Parental Participation in Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Parental Participation in Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the benefits of parents being actively engaged in their children’s education and building close and successful relationships between homes and schools.

appg_groups.name: Parkinsons
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkinson's
appg_groups.purpose: The group aims to keep Parkinson's on the political agenda to ensure government initiatives and policies meet the needs of people with the condition and their families and carers.

appg_groups.name: Parkrun
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Parkrun
appg_groups.purpose: To support parkrun and improve public health.

appg_groups.name: Parks and Green Spaces
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parks and Green Spaces
appg_groups.purpose: To address the most urgent issues affecting our parks and green spaces, including but not limited to funding, skills, inequality of access and provision, climate change, biodiversity and the impact they have on the nation’s health and wellbeing.

appg_groups.name: Penal Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Penal Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To increase members' knowledge of penal affairs and to work through parliamentary channels to reform the penal system.

appg_groups.name: Pensions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pensions
appg_groups.purpose: To develop and encourage pensions arrangements in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Performing Arts Education and Training
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Performing Arts Education and Training
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians in discussions relating to: appropriate training, education, assessment and professional practices across the performing arts, particularly drama, dance and musical theatre; practitioners continuing professional development within the creative and cultural industries; wider benefits of engagement with the performing arts for students, practitioners and audiences.

appg_groups.name: Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.purpose: To further understanding of the role of philanthropy, giving and social investment in parliament, and to act as a discussion forum for politicians, philanthropists, social investors and experts to develop policy to improve and increase the amount of giving and social investment to good causes in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Photography
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Photography
appg_groups.purpose: To promote interest in photography.

appg_groups.name: Political Literacy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Political Literacy
appg_groups.purpose: The key aim of this APPG will be to provide evidence for the importance of political literacy education in promoting youth participation in democratic life. The ultimate goal of this APPG will be to ensure that all young people become politically literate by the time they finish their secondary education.

appg_groups.name: Population Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Population, Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure the full implementation of the International Conference on Population and Development's programme of Action with specific reference to stabilisation of the world's population through choice and ensuring sustainable development in the UK and abroad.

appg_groups.name: Post Offices
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Post Offices
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the important economic and social contribution post offices and post masters make; to ensure their position as a vital public service; and to provide input into the areas of public policy which affect the post office.

appg_groups.name: Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: To provide awareness of the impact of poverty, its causes and consequences, and to encourage the spread of good practice to alleviate and eliminate it.

appg_groups.name: the Private Rented Sector
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Private Rented Sector
appg_groups.purpose: To raise greater awareness of the private rented housing sector in Parliament; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to the sector and engage with ministers, landlords, tenants and other interested parties; and to hold inquiries into policy and operational issues on the sector and produce reports.

appg_groups.name: Public Accountability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Public Accountability
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the need for greater public accountability to address systemic failures, past and ongoing, with a view to learning why public institutions failed to act in the public interest. To call for a duty of candour to protect those who have been failed by the existing law and justice system.

appg_groups.name: Publishing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Publishing
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the value of high quality publishing to UK society, culture and the economy. To foster a better understanding among parliamentarians about publishers, booksellers and associated fields, all of whom contribute to a world-leading publishing sector.

appg_groups.name: Race and Community
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Race and Community
appg_groups.purpose: The group focuses on issues of racial justice. It aims to increase the coverage in parliament of issues relating to race and ethnicity; to update members on these issues as well as on up-to-date research; and to connect the group with charities and other organisations working on these issues around the country.

appg_groups.name: Race Equality in Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Race Equality in Education
appg_groups.purpose: To advance race equality in the education sector. To support children and students from ethnic minority backgrounds, to enhance education environments, and to increase racial diversity in teaching across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.purpose: To keep parliamentarians and the government up to date with issues in horseracing and bloodstock; to foster good relations with the various parts of horseracing, and between them; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: Radiotherapy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Radiotherapy
appg_groups.purpose: To provide an effective voice for radiotherapy and improve access to radiotherapy for cancer patients, ensuring no-one has to travel more than 45 minutes to their nearest radiotherapy unit. To ensure radiotherapy receives increased funding so that patients are allowed to have the best radiotherapy for their individual cancer.

appg_groups.name: Rare Genetic and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rare, Genetic and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.purpose: To increase awareness in Parliament of rare, genetic and undiagnosed conditions and help to ensure that patients and families affected by those conditions have access to appropriate care and support.

appg_groups.name: Refugees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Refugees
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to refugees, both in the UK and abroad, and to promote the welfare of refugees.

appg_groups.name: Regeneration and Levelling Up
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Regeneration and Levelling Up
appg_groups.purpose: To inform and stimulate debate on relevant areas of policy affecting regeneration and levelling up and to introduce parliamentarians to experts and practitioners in the field.

appg_groups.name: Renters and Rental Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Renters and Rental Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the conditions of renters and provide a space in Parliament to have their voices heard; receive briefings from external organisations about the latest studies and research with concerns to the private rented sector; work co-operatively and in a cross-party way with the government on the introduction of the forthcoming Rental Reform Bill; arrange events in Parliament to allow for tenant organisations to meet with MPs to raise their concerns.

appg_groups.name: Respiratory Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Respiratory Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the importance of respiratory health and to promote effective policy for improving treatments and outcomes for respiratory illnesses.

appg_groups.name: Restorative Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Restorative Justice
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the use of restorative justice principles within the UK justice system and beyond; to raise the profile of restorative justice principles within Parliamnent; and to provide opportunities for policy discussion and consultation.

appg_groups.name: Retail Crime Safe and Sustainable High Streets
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Retail Crime, Safe and Sustainable High Streets
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG will cover all issues around safety and security on the high street including ensuring that the high street gets the investment it needs to be sustainable and deal with issues around anti-social behaviour and safe and secure access.

appg_groups.name: Road Freight and Logistics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Road Freight and Logistics
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and represent the interests of the UK road haulage, logistics and coaches sector and provide a forum to discuss opportunities and challenges.

appg_groups.name: Road Passenger Transport - Recovery and Renewal
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Road Passenger Transport - Recovery and Renewal
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for all stakeholders in the road passenger transport industry to consider and raise awareness of matters relating to the industry’s recovery from the effects of the Covid19 Pandemic and renewal in the face of climate change

appg_groups.name: the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.purpose: In recognising the persecution, murder and other atrocities committed against the Rohingya, the group will work towards protecting and enhancing the human rights and status of the Rohingya, and will assess and scrutinise any repatriation agreement made between Bangladesh and Myanmar.

appg_groups.name: the Rule of Law
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rule of Law
appg_groups.purpose: To promote parliamentary and public discussion of the rule of law as a practical concept and to mainstream the importance of the rule of law in Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Running
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Running
appg_groups.purpose: To provide government and related bodies with a better understanding of the running sector and to increase recognition and support for safe, standardised, consistent running and racing.

appg_groups.name: Rural Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Services
appg_groups.purpose: To promote a debate on the provision of rural services and to issue periodic reports.

appg_groups.name: Safeguarding in Faith Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Safeguarding in Faith Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on safeguarding concerns relevant to any community of faith, belief or religion. The APPG is attempting to raise awareness and improve policy and practice in relation to safeguarding in faith communities and by encouraging both the opportunity and responsibility of those faith groups and communities in creating safer places for all.

appg_groups.name: School Exclusions and Alternative Provision
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for School Exclusions and Alternative Provision
appg_groups.purpose: To improve outcomes for vulnerable children by facilitating upstream working to reduce preventable exclusions and improve the quality of education for children excluded from school.

appg_groups.name: School Food
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on School Food
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party parliamentary platform for the discussion of school food with stakeholders; to keep school food, child hunger and food education on the political agenda following the spot-light given during the pandemic; and to campaign to ensure that children receive high quality meals in and outside of school.

appg_groups.name: Schools Learning and Assessment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Schools, Learning and Assessment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support school level education and the quality of learning and assessment for all pupils.

appg_groups.name: Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and stakeholders to debate and highlight the value of science and technology in agriculture.

appg_groups.name: Self-Build Custom and Community Housebuilding and Placemaking
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Self-Build, Custom and Community Housebuilding and Placemaking
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for discussion and raising awareness of the self- commissioned homes sector, including custom and self-build, community housing, co-housing, and co-operative housing, and the sector’s contribution to making better places.

appg_groups.name: Self-Driving Vehicles
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Self-Driving Vehicles
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, industry and academics to promote the economic, environmental and safety benefits of self-driving vehicles for a variety of use cases across all parts of the UK.

appg_groups.name: Semiconductors
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Semiconductors
appg_groups.purpose: To champion the UK's semiconductors industry while advocating the national domestic capacity's role within the global supply chain. The group will engage with decision-makers in government to push forward the policy agenda surrounding semiconductor design and manufacturing in the UK, while highlighting the economic and skills benefits.

appg_groups.name: Sexual and Reproductive Health in the UK
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sexual and Reproductive Health in the UK
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness and understanding in Parliament of a range of issues relating to women’s reproductive health across the life course.

appg_groups.name: Shakespeare
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Shakespeare
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG will bring together parliamentarians with an interest in the works of Shakespeare both as a key part of our national culture but also a means of fostering inter-cultural dialogue around the world. It will provide a forum for parliamentarians to facilitate discussions and produce policy ideas.

benefits_details.source: Show Racism The Red Card Secretariat 9,001-10,500 03/03/2022 07/09/2022

appg_groups.name: Single Parent Families
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Single Parent Families
appg_groups.purpose: To collaborate across the political spectrum to campaign against legislative loopholes that disadvantage single parents, and for positive representation of

appg_groups.name: Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the interests of institutions that deliver sixth form education, and to advise government on the challenges facing 16 to18 education.

appg_groups.name: Skills Careers and Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Skills, Careers and Employment
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-party coalition of parliamentarians devoted to raising the profile of skills and employment policy. Brings together Parliament, employers, and the skills sector to ensure that skills policy promotes social mobility, lifelong learning opportunities and local economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Sleep
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sleep
appg_groups.purpose: To improve outcomes in sleep disorders and chronic insomnia for individuals and society.

appg_groups.name: Sleep Apnoea
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sleep Apnoea
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of sleep apnoea and its treatment.

appg_groups.name: Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of small and micro business issues in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Small Modular Reactors
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Small Modular Reactors
appg_groups.purpose: To support the roll-out of small modular reactors (SMR) to sites across the UK, to champion the SMR model, to encourage a diversity of design and providers and to engage UK industry in the development of SMRs including supporting engineering jobs in the UK.

appg_groups.name: SME Small and Medium-sized Enterprises House Builders
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) House Builders
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the operations of SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) house builders in the UK; discover and highlight best practice; review the regulatory environment affecting the market, looking at ways of improving the delivery of new homes, and making recommendations on how Parliament can improve regulation to deliver more effective building of homes by SMEs.

appg_groups.name: Smoking and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Smoking and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To monitor and discuss the health and social effects of smoking; to review potential changes to existing legislation to reduce levels of smoking; to assess the latest medical techniques to assist in smoking cessation; and to act as a resource for the group's members on all issues relating to smoking and public health.

appg_groups.name: Snooker
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Snooker
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of snooker.

appg_groups.name: Social Integration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Integration
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward a cross-party conversation on policy solutions to break down barriers to integration and create opportunities for people from all walks of life to connect with each other and build bonds of trust.

appg_groups.name: Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians and social scientists and by doing so demonstrate the relevance and value of social science research.

appg_groups.name: the South East
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the South East
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for Parliamentarians to discuss, with others, how to maintain the South East region as a great place to live, work and do business.

appg_groups.name: the great South West
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the great South West
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic and social advancement of the South West region as a great place to live, work and do business.

appg_groups.name: Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate a continuing discussion on how the UK can sustain a sovereign defence manufacturing capability.

appg_groups.name: Space
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Space
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness in Parliament of the importance and opportunities of space based capabilities to the UK economy, policy making, society and the space community; to highlight and promote the benefits from the UK's investment in space and its leading role within the global space economy.

appg_groups.name: Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.purpose: To support special schools and SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities) provision in mainstream school and college settings.

appg_groups.name: Spinal Cord Injury
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Spinal Cord Injury
appg_groups.purpose: To address care, medical treatment and other day-to-day issues faced by people with spinal cord injuries.

appg_groups.name: Sport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sport
appg_groups.purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice for sport in parliament and to promote the wider societal benefits of sport and physical activity in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Sport and Physical Activity in the Criminal Justice System
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sport and Physical Activity in the Criminal Justice System
appg_groups.purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice in parliament that promotes the benefits of sport-based interventions and physical activity as effective tools for the diversion and prevention of crime and the rehabilitation of people involved with the criminal justice system.

appg_groups.name: State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum in which to hold the government to account on the issue of transitional arrangements to compensate 1950's-born women who are affected by changes to the state pension age and to campaign on issues around the state pension age.

appg_groups.name: Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure a fair deal for the UK steel and metal related industries by liaising with and lobbying the government, to raise the profile of cultural, environmental and social issues in the industry and its communities, and to research and develop policies which will promote thriving steel and cast metal industries in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Stem Cell Transplantation and Advanced Cellular Therapies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stem Cell Transplantation and Advanced Cellular Therapies
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about the use of stem cell transplantation and advanced cellular and gene therapies in saving lives; to facilitate scrutiny of equitable access to and outcomes from stem cell transplantation and advanced cellular and gene therapies; and to promote the expansion of stem cell donation in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Stroke
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stroke
appg_groups.purpose: To keep stroke high on the parliamentary agenda. The Group aims to be the voice in Parliament of all those affected by stroke, and provides influence, challenge and scrutiny on multiple issues, including stroke rehabilitation, acute care, workforce and research.

appg_groups.name: Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Students
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for all parliamentarians to develop greater understanding of the range of issues affecting students in further and higher education. To ensure that student views and experiences are heard in Parliament, facilitate interaction between students and MPs and Peers, and ensure education policy takes account of student views.

appg_groups.name: Suicide and Self-Harm Prevention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Suicide and Self-Harm Prevention
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness within Parliament and encourage discussion and debate of all issues surrounding suicide and self-harm prevention.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote support and knowledge in parliament of the aviation industry's efforts to achieve sustainability, specifically their goal of net zero carbon emissions by 2050 in line with the government's overall target for the UK.

appg_groups.name: Swimming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Swimming
appg_groups.purpose: To promote swimming and other aquatic disciplines and to highlight the importance of swimming and water safety in schools.

appg_groups.name: Tamils
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tamils
appg_groups.purpose: To promote in Parliament peace with justice and dignity for Tamils in the Island of Sri Lanka and advance their development so as to recognise their legitimate socio-political aspirations.

appg_groups.name: Taxation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxation
appg_groups.purpose: To look at and understand tax policy and taxation on all levels including simplification and digitalisation, EU Brexit and its impact on the UK’s taxation system, and international taxation. To work in partnership with HM Treasury to create a 'safe space' for Parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to meet, discuss and develop innovative proposals to reform, simplify and make the UK’s taxation system fairer.

appg_groups.name: Tennis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tennis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of tennis, and to enable MPs and peers to play tennis matches together and compete with outside tennis teams.

appg_groups.name: Thalassaemia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Thalassaemia
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the blood disorder known as thalassaemia and to encourage policy changes that will support patients with this condition.

appg_groups.name: Theatre
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Theatre
appg_groups.purpose: To support the resilience and relevance of theatre in the UK for audiences, society and the industry. To identify and debate potential opportunities and issues for theatre in the UK. To support parliamentarians' understanding of the theatre and performing arts industry at a national and local level.

benefits_details.source: Society of London Theatre Joint Secretariat 1,501-3,000 14/01/2024 21/03/2024

appg_groups.name: Ticket Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ticket Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to the sale and resale of tickets, for events, with a particular focus on devising solutions to the problem of ticket touting.

appg_groups.name: the Timber Industries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Timber Industries
appg_groups.purpose: Our primary purpose is to grow the use of timber in order to help: expand our low-carbon, high-performance offsite manufacturing base for construction; decarbonise the built environment; create safer and higher quality buildings and building supply chains; contribute to growing, sustainably managed forests and biodiverse landscapes.

appg_groups.name: Trafficked Britons in Syria
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trafficked Britons in Syria
appg_groups.purpose: To seek a resolution to the cases of people from the UK who were trafficked by Daesh, and are now detained in North East Syria.

appg_groups.name: Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focus for UK parliamentary cross-party support for a comprehensive transatlantic trade and investment agreement; to contribute to greater public debate and understanding of potential benefits and drawbacks for British consumers, workers and businesses; to strengthen parliamentary and public scrutiny to help secure a successful agreement.

appg_groups.name: Transport Across the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Transport Across the North
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and investment in all modes of transport across the North of England and to provide better opportunities for MPs representing Northern constituencies to meet with senior officials and receive briefings from Transport for the North.

appg_groups.name: Transport Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Transport Safety
appg_groups.purpose: To provide opportunities to debate transport safety matters (on road, rail, air

appg_groups.name: the Union
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Union
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, social, cultural and constitutional benefits of the union of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; To foster good relations between the four countries of the UK and their devolved administrations; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: the United Nations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations
appg_groups.purpose: The primary objective of the APPG is to raise awareness of the UN among MPs and Peers; about its contributions across the areas of peace and security, development and human rights; about the scope of international law and its relevance to the UK; and about the applicability of the UN to the British electorate.

appg_groups.name: the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development and monitor their implementation.

appg_groups.name: Uyghurs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Uyghurs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the persecution against the Uyghur community in Xinjiang, China.

appg_groups.name: Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.purpose: Raising the political profile of the importance of routine vaccinations, ensuring equitable access to vaccines for everyone, no matter where they live.

appg_groups.name: Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of vascular and venous disease and to encourage actions to promote a greater priority for its prevention and treatment; to encourage research into the causes of vascular and venous disease; to advance excellence and innovation in vascular and venous disease and related cardiovascular conditions.

appg_groups.name: Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.purpose: To work with the games and interactive entertainment industry, including with its trade body UK Interactive Entertainment, to promote the industry's economic, technological and cultural contributions within Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Visual Arts
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Visual Arts
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG provides a forum for parliamentarians to discuss the role played by the visual arts in the UK. It informs parliamentarians about the latest issues affecting the visual arts community, the contribution the visual arts make to our society and economy and puts forward ideas about how it can remain a vibrant and world-leading sector.

appg_groups.name: Vulnerable Groups to Pandemics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vulnerable Groups to Pandemics
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and stakeholders to consider the needs of vulnerable groups to pandemics and to provide an effective voice in parliament; to raise awareness of specific vulnerable patients; to encourage actions to promote a greater priority for prevention, treatment and support for those groups; to inform better policy decisions and public debate related to the needs of vulnerable groups.

appg_groups.name: War Crimes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on War Crimes
appg_groups.purpose: To look into matters relating to the presence of alleged Rwandan war criminals in the UK and the prosecution of those who participated in the Rwandan genocide against the Tutsis in 1994.

appg_groups.name: Water Sanitation and Hygiene
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Water, Sanitation and Hygiene
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness within parliament and government of the impact that a lack of water, sanitation and hygiene has on the lives of people around the world, and the governments obligation to help meet the Sustainable Development Goal on water and sanitation.

appg_groups.name: the Waterways
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Waterways
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to navigable (and formerly navigable) rivers, canals, estuaries and lakes in the UK, including the potential social, economic and cultural impact of the regeneration of those waterways and extension of the system.

appg_groups.name: the Western Gateway
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Western Gateway
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians in support of the Western Gateway, a cross-border economic partnership of local authorities, city regions, Local Enterprise Partnerships and governments covering south Wales and western England.

appg_groups.name: the Western Rail Link to Heathrow
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Western Rail Link to Heathrow
appg_groups.purpose: To support the case for and delivery of the Western Rail Link to Heathrow.

appg_groups.name: Wetlands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Wetlands
appg_groups.purpose: To build awareness, engagement and support amongst parliamentarians for the policies and partnerships required to restore and create wetlands, as well as ensure they are well managed and protected into the future.

appg_groups.name: Whistleblowing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Whistleblowing
appg_groups.purpose: Whistleblowers are a vital element of a transparent society. In 1998 the Public Interest Disclosure Act was introduced to protect employees who speak out. In the face of many recent scandals the APPG is looking at the effectiveness of this legislation and how it might be improved.

appg_groups.name: Wilton Park
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wilton Park
appg_groups.purpose: For parliamentarians to learn more about and better understand and support Wilton Park, offering advice and encouragement in both its everyday and long-term work.

appg_groups.name: Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and inform on the economic and commercial benefits of the UK wine and spirit trade; to inform and stimulate debate on issues of relevance to the trade and to consumers, including English wine and British spirits; and to introduce parliamentarians to members of the trade from their constituencies.

appg_groups.name: Women and Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women and Work
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion around women and work.

appg_groups.name: Women in Contact with the Justice System
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in Contact with the Justice System
appg_groups.purpose: To increase the knowledge and awareness of the experiences of women in contact with the justice system and promote approaches that reduce criminalisation and meet women’s needs.

appg_groups.name: Women in Defence
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in Defence
appg_groups.purpose: For the promotion of all women in the defence community.

appg_groups.name: Women in Parliament
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in Parliament
appg_groups.purpose: Brings together MPs and peers to discuss and campaign for increasing the number of women in parliament in all parties and, to support women in parliament and those standing for public office.

appg_groups.name: Women in Transport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in Transport
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss and overcome the under-representation of women in transport by promoting best practice examples of employers leading the way in gender diversifying their workforce and by being the voice for all women using our networks.

appg_groups.name: Women Peace and Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women, Peace and Security
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and analysis of issues relating to the Women, Peace and Security agenda. To bring together parliamentarians, policymakers, academia and civil society to scrutinise and strengthen the UK government's implementation of commitments to women and girls' rights in fragile and conflict-affected states.

appg_groups.name: Womens Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Football
appg_groups.purpose: To promote women's football.

appg_groups.name: Womens Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Health
appg_groups.purpose: To empower women to ensure that they can make an informed choice about the best treatment for them and that they are treated with dignity and respect.

appg_groups.name: the Wood Panel Industry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Wood Panel Industry
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the vital contribution that wood panel manufacturers make to the regional and national economies within the UK and to ensure growth for

appg_groups.name: Woods and Trees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Woods and Trees
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the UK's woods and trees and to discuss the steps necessary to protect, restore and expand them in a time of climate and nature crises.

appg_groups.name: Wrestling
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wrestling
appg_groups.purpose: To promote, support, and raise awareness of professional wrestling; to work with the industry to improve it and to build confidence; to celebrate British success in professional wrestling.

appg_groups.name: the Yazidis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Yazidis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the issue of the Daesh genocide against the Yazidis and ensure comprehensive responses, including justice for the victims and survivors, assistance with their needs, and ensure non-repetition of the atrocities in the future.

appg_groups.name: Yoga in Society
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Yoga in Society
appg_groups.purpose: To support wellbeing across the UK by disseminating the benefits of yoga through a biomedical lens. The APPG is focused on designing constructive ways to integrate yoga into schools, healthcare, occupational health, and criminal justice, and within Parliament by endeavouring to offer free classes to all who work there.

appg_groups.name: Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.purpose: To bring MPs of all parties together with key leaders - those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all local communities and economies.

appg_groups.name: Young Carers and Young Adult Carers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Young Carers and Young Adult Carers
appg_groups.purpose: A forum for key issues affecting young carers and young adult carers,

appg_groups.name: Youth Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of issues which affect and concern young people; to encourage dialogue between parliamentarians, young people and youth services; and to encourage a co-ordinated and coherent approach to policy making on youth affairs.

appg_groups.name: Youth Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Employment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote youth employment in all its forms and the role of young people within the economy; to ensure that young people's voices are heard; to highlight the need for quality opportunities; and to share best practice.
